required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Developing Risk Prediction Model and Testing the Effect of Dual Task Walking on Improving Cognitive Function in Patients With Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Developing Risk Prediction Model of Mild Cognitive Impairment in Patients With Colorectal Cancer From Active Treatment to Survivor and Testing the Effect of Dual Task Walking on Improving Cognitive Function

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this three-year study are to explore cognitive function under different stages of colorectal cancer (CRC) and its related factors; and understand its disturbance and coping process caused by cancer-induced cognitive impairment (CICI) from patient perspective; and further to test effect of dual-task walking on improving cognitive function in CRC patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Developing risk prediction model of mild cognitive impairment in patients with colorectal cancer from active treatment to survivor by exploring the effect of surgery and chemotherapy on CICI, and to identify high risk population; and testing the effect of dual-task walking on improving cognitive function (memory, executive function and attention) in CRC patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline cognitive function at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: The questionnaire includes 37 items to assess perceived cognitive function

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline cognitive function at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Three neuropsychological battery tests will be used to assess cognitive function of executive function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline cognitive function at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: One neuropsychological battery test will be used to assess cognitive function of attention

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline cognitive function at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Five neuropsychological battery tests will be used to assess cognitive function of memory

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline symptom at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire includes 24 items to assess symptom severity

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline fatigue at 12 months
other_outcome.description: The questionnaire includes 15 items to assess fatigue level

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline depression symptom at 12 months
other_outcome.description: The questionnaire includes 20 items to assess frequency of depression symptom

arm_group.description: Participants in the experimental group will receive 3 times interventions during 10th to 12th course of chemotherapy and 12 weekly phone-call to assess effect and barriers of dual-task walking.
Participants in control group will receive usual care.

intervention.description: Participants will receive 3 times interventions during 10th to 12th course of chemotherapy and 12 weekly phone-call to assess effect and barriers of dual-task walking.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with newly diagnosed stage I to III colorectal cancer and Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) < 24.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cancer other than colorectal cancer or have cancer recurrence.
